author: gstein
msg: Initial brain dump of the svn_auth library. Code comments forthcoming,
once I do some coding to validate the approach.
Basic structure is an auth manager, holding providers for different
kinds of credentials. A client iterates through credentials for a
given kind until a good one is found. Then, it can save them back.
Internally, svn_auth maps the incoming iteration into iterating over
the ordered set of providers. The cmdline client will have two
providers: any user/pass from the cmdline (highest ordering; this
provider can also prevent caching of user/pass based on incoming
switches), and a way to query the user for user/pass (lowest
ordering). libsvn_client will insert a provider between those to ask
the WC for cached auth info.
